chess

Class ChessBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.ChessBoard

  • public class ChessBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    ChessBoard is the class that handles all of the board logic. This includes checking for valid inputs, keeping track of "check", housing the board, print functions, setting the board on start and moving pieces The variable board is where all the pieces are stored, the boolean inCheck tracks if the current players king is in check, and if so it restricts which movements are valid(only moves that take them out of check remain valid)
    Author:
    Scott Lahart, Niles Ball

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) ChessPiece[][] board
      The board which holds all the ChessPieces in the game, if there is no piece in a location it is set to null
      (package private) boolean inCheck
      Tells whether either player is in check

      • board

        ChessPiece[][] board

        Tells whether either player is in check

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChessBoard

        public ChessBoard()
        ChessBoard constructer. Calls setBoard which puts pieces in starting position, sets inCheck to false and sets the turnCounter to 0

    • Method Detail

      • clearBoard

        public void clearBoard()
        clearBoard sets the board to be empty

      • printBoard

        public void printBoard()
        printBoard prints the state of board[][] to the console window. If a space is null(empty) it prints the appropriate checkered pattern. Additionally this will print the row and column tags, with columns being identified by letters a-h, and rows by numbers 1-8

      • setBoard

        public void setBoard()
        setBoard initalizes the board to the start position. Calls initializeRow function to set non pawn pieces.

      • initializeRow

        private void initializeRow(int row,
                           ChessPiece.Color col)
        initializeRow is a helper function of setBoard which sets the non pawn pieces on the board. It takes the color of a player, and the row that players pieces start on as param.
        Parameters:
        row - row is the row on the board that a players non pawn pieces begin on
        col - col is the color of the player whose pieces are being spawned by initializeRow

      • isValidMove

        public boolean isValidMove(int startRow,
                           int startCol,
                           int endRow,
                           int endCol,
                           ChessPiece.Color color)
        isValidMove is the main function in checking if any given input is valid. It takes the piece to be moved, denoted by (startRow,startCol) and checks if it can move to (endRow,endCol). This function also takes a chess pieces color to ensure a player is moving one of their own pieces. isValidMove works by checking first if the parameters are in the boards range, then if a piece exists in the start position and it belongs to the current player, then it calls that pieces specific isValidMove function Due to the heavier constraints on king movements, the kings isValidMove logic was moved into ChessBoard under the function "validKing" If the validMove functions return true, the function checks if the player is in "check", and if so, tests the move to see if the players king is out of check after executing the move. If so, return true
        Parameters:
        startRow - startRow is the row of the first input, where the piece to be moved is located
        startCol - startCol is the column of the first input, where the piece to be moved is located
        endRow - endRow is the row of the location attempting to be moved to
        endCol - endCol is the column of the location attempting to be moved to
        color - color is the color of the current player, used to check they are moving a piece they own
        Returns:
        Returns true if the player is moving a piece they own, in a legal way, that would not put their king into, or leave their king in check. Otherwise returns false.

      • move

        public void move(int startRow,
                 int startCol,
                 int endRow,
                 int endCol)
        move is the function called to execute moving a piece. After isValidMove is called, if the move is valid, this function is called to execute input. If the move is valid, then it means the player is not in check, or exiting check, so inCheck is set to false. The turn counter is likewise incremented Afterwards, the function "isCheck" is run on the opponent to see if the move executed has put the enemy into check. inCheck is set accordingly
        Parameters:
        startRow - startRow is the row of the to be moved piece
        startCol - startCol is the column of the to be moved piece
        endRow - endRow is the end row location of the to be moved piece
        endCol - endCol is the end column location of the to be moved piece

      • isPathToKing

        private boolean isPathToKing(int pieceRow,
                             int pieceCol)
        isPathToKing checks if a given piece has a valid move to the enemies king. It does this by taking the piece which is passed by row and column in the parameters, and then checking every board location. If a board location contains the enemy king, it calls the pieces "isValidMove" function with its current location as the start row and column and the kings current position as the end row and column
        Parameters:
        pieceRow - pieceRow is the row of the piece to be tested
        pieceCol - pieceCol is the column of the piece to be tested
        Returns:
        isPathToKing returns true if the piece can attack the enemy king, or false if it has no move to attack the king

      • isCheck

        public boolean isCheck(ChessPiece.Color color)
        isCheck determines if the passed players king is in Check. This is done by finding each enemy piece and calling the "isPathToKing" function on it.
        Parameters:
        color - color is the color of the player being tested for check. ie: isCheck(white) returns whether white is in check
        Returns:
        isCheck returns true if the player is in check, or false if they are not in check

      • isCheckMate

        public boolean isCheckMate(ChessPiece.Color color)
        isCheckMate checks if the passed player is in checkmate. It does this by calling "canRemoveCheck" on every piece owned by the player. Those pieces are then tested for all possible moves they can make. If any move would break the check, isCheckMate returns false. Otherwise the player has no valid moves and is in checkmate, returning true
        Parameters:
        color - color is the color of the player being tested for checkmate. IE: isCheckMate(white) tests if white has lost the game
        Returns:
        isCheckMate returns true if the passed color player has lost, or false if they still have valid moves left

      • canRemoveCheck

        private boolean canRemoveCheck(ChessPiece defender,
                               int row,
                               int col)
        canRemoveCheck cycles through all of a given pieces possible moves, and tests each one to see if it would remove check. It does this by calling "isValidMove" on all board locations for the given piece. If a move is valid, it then tests the move by putting the current piece in that spot into "temp" and making the move, then testing for "check" once again. If check is removed, the player has a valid move left. If no move by this piece can remove check, it returns false.
        Parameters:
        defender - defender is the chess piece being tested to see if it can removed the "check" on their king. defender can be any piece, including the players king
        row - row is the row location of the defender
        col - col is the column location of the defender
        Returns:
        canRemoveCheck returns true if the piece has a valid move that removes the "check" on their king. Returns false if no move exists

      • pawnPromotion

        public void pawnPromotion(int row,
                          int col,
                          char piece)
        pawnPromotion reads the input to determine what piece the pawn should be promoted to. This is called by the "chess" main class Note: If no promotion was specified, the "chess" class passes a 'Q' to promote to queen
        Parameters:
        row - row is the row of the pawn being promoted
        col - col is the column of the pawn being promoted
        piece - piece is the char identifier of what piece the pawn is to be promoted to

      • validKing

        private boolean validKing(int startRow,
                          int startCol,
                          int endRow,
                          int endCol)
        validKing is the kings personal "isValidMove" function. As the kings movement is much more restricted, it was placed here in the chessBoard class. ValidKing checks what type of move the king is doing. If the distance being moved is greater than 1, it checks if the king is trying to castle, and if so checks if the king and rook pair have moved as well as if any spaces the king will move through are attackable by the enemy. If the king is not trying to castle, it checks that the king is moving at most one space in any direction
        Parameters:
        startRow - startRow is the row the king starts in
        startCol - startCol is the column the king starts in
        endRow - endRow is the row the king is trying to move to
        endCol - endCol is the column the king is trying to move to
        Returns:
        validKing returns true if the move is acceptable, false if it is invalid

      • isSpotAttackable

        private boolean isSpotAttackable(ChessPiece.Color color,
                                 int testRow,
                                 int testCol)
        isSpotAttackable checks if a given space can be attacked by an enemy. This is used in checking if the king can castle through certain spaces
        Parameters:
        color - color is the color of the friendly team
        testRow - testRow is the row of the location being tested for safety
        testCol - testCol is the column of the location being tested for safety
        Returns:
        isSpotAttackable returns true if an enemy can attack the location, false if the space is safe.

      • moveKing

        private void moveKing(int startRow,
                      int startCol,
                      int endRow,
                      int endCol)
        moveKing is the kings personal move function. It takes into account potentially castling, and calls castleKing if needed.
        Parameters:
        startRow - startRow is the row of the king
        startCol - startCol is the column of the king
        endRow - endRow is the row the king is moving to
        endCol - endCol is the column the king is moving to

      • castleKing

        private void castleKing(int startRow,
                        int startCol,
                        int endRow,
                        int endCol)
        castleKing is called when the king is castling. This will move the king horizontally 2 spaces, and place the pair rook to the inside of the king
        Parameters:
        startRow - startRow is the row of the king
        startCol - startCol is the column of the king
        endRow - endRow is the end row of the king
        endCol - endCol is the end column of the king
